newsitem.title: FRANCE: SNAGFA AGM and industry seminar set for May 29.
newsitem.headline: SNAGFA AGM and industry seminar set for May 29.

text.p: France's air freight forwarding association, SNAGFA, is holding its annual general meeting on May 29 1997 at the Hotel Softel at Paris/Charles-de-Gaulle airport.

"The AGM wil be followed by a seminar bringing together all sections of the air cargo community - airport authorities, customs, airlines, forwarding agents and shippers," SNAGFA general secretary, Bruno Charrois, told Reuters.

"One of the topics discussed at the seminar will be the practical implications of the implementation of an ICAO/IATA directive, endorsed by civil aviation authorities in the European Union, on air freight security," Charrois said.

A second topic will be the process of bringing the status of French customs clearance agents into compliance with EU customs legislation, Charrois added. This debate will be led by Jean Chabrerie, President of French freight transport and forwarding federation, the FFOCT.
The seminar will be followed by SNAGFA s "Cargo Airline of the Year" awards.
- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017
